# Does `pyfastx` use 0 or 1 based coordinates?


answer: pyfastx does use 1 based coordiantes for the fa.fetch() method. In addition, how stop codon and and transcripts were constructed needs scrutiny in because of how base is handled. 

::: {#ff5861ed .cell execution_count=1}
``` {.python .cell-code}
import os
import pyfastx
```
:::


::: {#9b3be815 .cell execution_count=2}
``` {.python .cell-code}
print(os.getcwd())
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
/project/yangili1/cdai/splice-pub/analysis
```
:::
:::


::: {#448e0e2b .cell execution_count=3}
``` {.python .cell-code}
fa_file = './test.fa'
```
:::


::: {#533f5c27 .cell execution_count=4}
``` {.python .cell-code}
with open(fa_file) as f:
  fa_text = f.readlines()
```
:::


::: {#d65062f8 .cell execution_count=5}
``` {.python .cell-code}
  fa_text
```

::: {#7f356f8a .cell execution_count=6}
``` {.python .cell-code}
fa = pyfastx.Fasta(fa_file)
```
:::


::: {#068f42bf .cell execution_count=7}
``` {.python .cell-code}
for seq in fa:
  print(seq.name)
  print(seq.seq)
  print(seq.description)
  print('\n\n')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
JZ822577.1

JZ822577.1 contig1 cDNA library of flower petals in tree peony by suppression subtractive hybridization Paeonia suffruticosa cDNA, mRNA sequence



JZ822578.1

JZ822578.1 contig2 cDNA library of flower petals in tree peony by suppression subtractive hybridization Paeonia suffruticosa cDNA, mRNA sequence



```
:::
:::


::: {#e8549702 .cell execution_count=8}
``` {.python .cell-code}
fa.fetch('JZ822577.1', (1,6))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=8}
```
'CTCTAG'
```
:::
:::


::: {#f4041d99 .cell execution_count=9}
``` {.python .cell-code}
fa.fetch('JZ822577.1', (1,6), strand = '-')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=9}
```
'CTAGAG'
```
:::
:::
